qas.question: What event sets the boundary for the Triassic?
What percentage of marine life died during the extinction?
How many terrestrial species died during the extinction?
What is the largest extinction of species in Earth's history known as?
What is the possible cause of the upper Cretaceous extinction event ?
What percentage of marine life growth happened during the Permian–Triassic era?
How many terrestrial species were created during the Permian–Triassic era?
Large volcanic eruptions contributed to the expansion of what period?
What percent of terrestrial vertebrates became extinct on the Yucatán Peninsula?
What percentage of all genera thrived during the Cretaceous–Paleogene era?

context: The lower (Triassic) boundary is set by the <a0_0>Permian–Triassic extinction<a0_0/> event, during which approximately <a1_0><b5_0>90% to 96%<b5_0/><a1_0/> of marine species and <a2_0><b6_0><b8_0>70%<b8_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> of terrestrial vertebrates became extinct. It is also known as the "<a3_0>Great Dying<a3_0/>" because it is considered the largest mass extinction in the Earth's history. The upper (Cretaceous) boundary is set at the Cretaceous–Tertiary (KT) extinction event (now more accurately called the Cretaceous–Paleogene (or <a4_0>K–Pg) extinction<a4_0/> event), which may have been caused by the impactor that created Chicxulub Crater on the Yucatán Peninsula. Towards the Late Cretaceous large volcanic eruptions are also believed to have contributed to the <b7_0>Cretaceous–Paleogene<b7_0/> extinction event. Approximately <b9_0>50%<b9_0/> of all genera became extinct, including all of the non-avian dinosaurs.
